contest-event.event-date:
Nov. 11, 1922 D Motherwell Contest
Motherwell Contest 0 Own Choice Test Piece Contest
motherwell-contest
None
Town Hall, Motherwell, North Lanarkshire, Scotland, UK Scottish Amateur Band Association contest - open to the West of Scotland (second section). Five prize winners go forward to final in Dunfermline on 9th December 1921
12 bands competed.
Prizes: £12, £8, £6, £3, £1
After the contest a number of bands were disqualified:
Barrhead - for playing unregistered players Greenfield - for playing a player registered with a 1st Section band Bearmore Works - for playing a member who was under suspension.
As a result the bands which went forward to the final (representing the West of Scotland against the East of Scotland), were Shotts Foundry, St John's (Port Glasgow) and St Lawrence (Greenock)
Aug. 6, 2013, 7:18 p.m. Nov. 23, 2014, 10:49 p.m.
1 Barrhead Burgh Unknown
2 Greenfield Colliery Unknown
3 Shotts Foundry Unknown
4 Beardmore's Works Unknown
5 St John's (Port Glasgow) Unknown
Unknown Result St. Lawrence Silver Prize Unknown
